newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Bangladesh taka closes flat in dull session.
newsitem.headline: Bangladesh taka closes flat in dull session.

text.p: The Bangladesh taka closed flat at 42.5475/5480 to the dollar after a session of dull interbank trading on Sunday, dealers said.
The local unit was quoted in a wide range at 42.5470/5495 to the dollar in early trading.
Dealers said major players were absent and there were very few deals.
The interbank call money rates were traded between 5.0 percent and 5.75 percent against Saturday's range of 4.75-5.5 percent, dealers said.
